intro: Parartocarpus venenosus subsp. forbesii, commonly known as the Forbes' poisonwood, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its toxic latex, which contains irritants that can cause skin and eye irritation. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough texture, while its flowers are unisexual and clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
